pages.title: Check if you can apply for a Farming Transformation Fund Adding Value Grant

components.name: startInfoOne
components.title: Html
components.content:
Use this service to:

  • check if you can apply for a grant for your project (takes about 5 minutes)
  • check how well your project fits the funding priorities (takes about 15 minutes if you have all the project details)

You can apply if you:

  • are a grower or producer of agricultural or horticultural produce
  • are a business processing agricultural or horticultural products that is at least 50% owned by agricultural or horticultural producers
  • will do the grant-funded work in England
  • estimate the project costs are over £62,500

components.name: startInsetText
components.title: Inset text
components.content: If your project is eligible, you can submit your answers to the Rural Payments Agency (RPA) to request the full application form.

components.name: startInfoTwo
components.title: Html
components.content:
Before you start

To use the checker, you need:

  • information about your business (for example, number of employees, turnover)
  • information about the project (for example, the types of products being processed and how you will add value, the impact the project will have)
  • a list of the items you'd like to buy for the project
  • an estimate of the total cost of the items

If you do not enter any information for more than 20 minutes, your application will time out and you will have to start again.

Problems using the online service

If you have any problems using the online service, contact the RPA.

Telephone

Telephone: 03000 200 301

Telephone: 03000 200 301

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm (except public holidays)

components.name: natureOfBusinessCannotApply
components.title: Html
components.content:
This grant is for businesses who:

  • are agricultural or horticultural growers or producers
  • are a business processing agricultural or horticultural products that is at least 50% owned by agricultural or horticultural producers

See other grants you may be eligible for.

pages.title: You cannot apply for a grant from this scheme

components.name: countryCannotApplyInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
This grant is only for projects in England.

Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland have other grants available.

pages.title: You cannot apply for a grant from this scheme

components.name: cannotApplyProjectStartInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
You cannot apply for a grant if you have already started work on the project.

Starting the project or committing to any costs (such as placing orders) before you receive a funding agreement invalidates your application.

See other grants you may be eligible for

pages.title: Do you want to build a new smaller abattoir?

components.name: smallerAbattoirYesNoField
components.title: Do you want to build a new smaller abattoir?
components.hint: A smaller abattoir is a red meat abattoir that processes up to 10,000 livestock units each year or a poultry abattoir that slaughters up to 500,000 birds each year.

customValidationMessages.any.required: Select yes if you want to build a new smaller abattoir

pages.title: Will this abattoir provide services to other farmers?

components.name: otherFarmersYesNoField
components.title: Will this abattoir provide services to other farmers?
components.hint: For example, farmers pay you to slaughter their livestock.

customValidationMessages.any.required: Select yes if this abattoir will provide services to other farmers

pages.title: You cannot apply for a grant from this scheme

components.name: cannotApplyOtherFarmersInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
You must provide some abattoir services to other farmers if you are building a new smaller abattoir with this grant.

See other grants you may be eligible for

components.hint: Fruit that grows on trees, for example apples, pears, quinces, medlars, plums, peaches, apricots and cherries

customValidationMessages.any.required: Select yes if you want to build new controlled atmosphere storage for top fruit

components.name: projectItemsCheckboxesField
components.title: What eligible items does your project need?
components.hint:
Storage facilities will only be funded as part of a bigger project and cannot be more than 50% of the total grant funding.

Select all the items your project needs

customValidationMessages.any.required: Select all the items your project needs

components.name: cannotApplyProjectItemsInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
This grant is for:

  • constructing or improving buildings for processing
  • processing equipment or machinery
  • retail facilities

See other grants you may be eligible for

components.content: ! WarningStorage facilities cannot be more than 50% of the total grant funding.

pages.title: What is the estimated cost of the items?

components.name: projectCostInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
Do not include VAT

Enter cost of items, for example {{ 695000 | formatCurrency: 'en-GB', 'GBP', 0, 'decimal' }}

customValidationMessages.any.required: Enter the estimated cost of the items
customValidationMessages.number.max: Enter a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits
customValidationMessages.number.min: Enter a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits

pages.title: You cannot apply for a grant from this scheme

components.name: projectCostCannotApplyInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
The minimum grant you can apply for is £25,000 (40% of £62,500).

See other grants you may be eligible for

pages.title: Potential grant funding

components.name: potentialFundingInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
{% assign estimatedCost = 'projectCostNumberField' | answer %} {% assign eligibilityMultiplier = 0.4 %} {% assign eligibilityAmount = estimatedCost | times: eligibilityMultiplier %} {% if eligibilityAmount <= 300000 and eligibilityAmount >= 25000 %} You may be able to apply for grant funding of up to {{ eligibilityAmount | formatCurrency: 'en-GB', 'GBP', 0 }} (40% of {{ estimatedCost | formatCurrency: 'en-GB', 'GBP', 0 }}).{% elsif eligibilityAmount > 300000 %} You may be able to apply for grant funding of up to £300,000, based on the estimated cost of {{ estimatedCost | formatCurrency: 'en-GB', 'GBP', 0 }}.

The maximum grant you can apply for is £300,000.
{% endif %}

components.name: potentialFundingWarning
components.title: Html
components.content: ! WarningThere's no guarantee the project will receive a grant.

pages.title: {% assign estimatedCost = 'projectCostNumberField' | answer %} {% assign applicantPayMultiplier = 0.6 %} {% assign applicantPayAmount = estimatedCost | times: applicantPayMultiplier %} {% assign grantPayAmount = estimatedCost | minus: applicantPayAmount %} {% if grantPayAmount >= 300000 %} {% assign applicantPayAmount = estimatedCost | minus: 300000 %} {% endif %} Can you pay the remaining costs of {{ applicantPayAmount | formatCurrency: 'en-GB', 'GBP', 0 }}?

customValidationMessages.any.required: Select yes if you can pay the remaining costs

pages.title: You cannot apply for a grant from this scheme

components.name: cannotApplyRemainingCostsInfo
components.title: Html
components.content:
You cannot use public money (for example, grant funding from government or local authorities) towards the project costs.

You also cannot use money from a producer organisation under the Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Aid Scheme.

For example, you can use:

  • loans
  • overdrafts
  • delinked payments

See other grants you may be eligible for

pages.title: Confirmation

items.text: A grower or producer of agricultural or horticultural produce
items.description: For example, arable or livestock farmer, fruit producer, salad grower

items.text: A business processing agricultural or horticultural products that is at least 50% owned by agricultural or horticultural producers
items.description: For example, a cheese production business owned by a group of farmers

items.text: A woodland manager processing wild venison products

lists.title: Who is applying for this grant?
lists.name: applyingList

lists.title: What type of produce is being processed?
lists.name: produceProcessedList

items.description: For example, crushing of oilseeds, rolling or flaking of grains as food ingredients
For example, processing and packing wild venison meat
For example, processing and bottling milk or slaughtering, cutting, processing and packing meat
For example, processing animal hides and leather, processing fibres such as wool, flax and hemp
For example, processing and repacking hay and straw for specialist markets or retail sale
For example, grading and packing of soft fruit, washing and packing vegetables, packing salad crops
For example, processing and packing ornamental flowers and bulbs after harvesting

lists.title: How will this project add value to the produce?
lists.name: howAddingValueList

items.text: Introducing a new product to your farm
items.description: For example, processing meat to burgers, milk to cheese, cereals to beer or spirits.
For example, washing and grading vegetables, egg grading, optical grading of top fruit.
For example, packing top fruit, bagging vegetables, bottling wine.

items.text: A new retail facility to sell direct to consumers

lists.title: What impact will this project have?
lists.name: projectImpactList

items.description: For example, retail and internet sales.

items.text: Starting to make added-value products for the first time
items.description: This only applies if you do not already make added-value products.

lists.title: What is the legal status of your business?
lists.name: legalStatusList

lists.title: Does the project have planning permission?
lists.name: planningPermissionList

items.text: Should be in place by the time I make my full application
Will not be in place by the time I make my full application

items.description: For example, quotes from suppliers, applying for planning permission

items.text: Yes, we have begun project work
items.description: For example, started construction work, signing contracts, placing orders

items.text: No, we have not done any work on this project yet

lists.title: What eligible items does your project need?
lists.name: projectItemsList

items.text: Constructing or improving buildings for processing
items.description: For example, a new building for cheese making, extending an existing building to install a new meat-cutting and packing line
For example, equipment and machinery for pasteurising and bottling milk, a meat cutting and packing line or vegetable washing and packing
For example, shops or display cabinets

lists.title: Does your project also need storage facilities?

items.text: Yes, we will need storage facilities
No, we do not need storage facilities
